question: Which classical author wrote the Anabasis?

The title "Anabasis" and the work's seven-book structure reflect Arrian's emulation of the Greek historian Xenophon, whose own "Anabasis" in seven books concerned the earlier campaign "up-country" of Cyrus the Younger in 401 BC.

The Anabasis is a historical account written by the classical author Xenophon. It details the journey of Greek mercenaries from Persia back to Greece after the death of their employer, Cyrus the Younger, in 401 BC. This historical context and the author's background solidify the fact that Xenophon is the classical author who wrote the Anabasis.

Xenophon
